title: sleep
comment: A state of slumber or rest, reflecting tiredness and the need for refreshment. Although sleep is a natural physical process, Scripture also uses the term in a number of important spiritual senses.

children.title: sleep, physical
children.comment: A gift from God providing necessary rest, usually at night, for the restoration of mind and body. It is sometimes denied, sometimes used by God for his purposes and sometimes abused by people.

children.title: Sleep is a gift from God
It is God's gift to his faithful people
It is often denied to the wicked
It is associated with sexual activity
Deep sleep for the creation of Eve

secondaryrefs.comment: The sleep in this instance is symbolic.

children.title: sleep, spiritual
children.comment: Scripture often uses sleep as an image of spiritual laziness or a lack of alertness towards God.

children.title: Sleep as an image of spiritual laziness
God's call to awake from sleep
The image of God awaking from sleep
Prayers for God to rise up against his enemies
The contrast between God who never sleeps and false gods
sleep, and death
children.comment: Scripture often uses sleep as an image of death, indicating that believers will be awakened to resurrection on the last day.

children.title: Death described in the imagery of sleep
The sleep of death for human beings in general
Death as resting with the ancestors
Those who fall asleep in Christ
Death is not the end of existence
Sleep denoting the finality of judgment for the lost
